Ephraim feedeth on wind, and followeth after the east wind: he daily increaseth lies and desolation; and they do make a covenant with the Assyrians, and oil is carried into Egypt.
The LORD hath also a controversy with Judah, and will punish Jacob according to his ways; according to his doings will he recompense him.<RF>punish: Heb. visit upon<Rf>
He took his brother by the heel in the womb, and by his strength he had power with God:<RF>had…: Heb. was a prince, or, behaved himself princely<Rf>
Yea, he had power over the angel, and prevailed: he wept, and made supplication unto him: he found him <FI>in<Fi> Bethel, and there he spake with us;
Even the LORD God of hosts; the LORD <FI>is<Fi> his memorial.
Therefore turn thou to thy God: keep mercy and judgment, and wait on thy God continually.<CM>
<FI>He is<Fi> a merchant, the balances of deceit <FI>are<Fi> in his hand: he loveth to oppress.<RF>a merchant: or, Canaan<Rf><RF>oppress: or, deceive<Rf>

And Ephraim said, Yet I am become rich, I have found me out substance: <FI>in<Fi> all my labours they shall find none iniquity in me that <FI>were<Fi> sin.<RF>in all…: or, all my labours suffice me not: he shall have punishment of iniquity in whom is sin<Rf><RF>that: Heb. which<Rf>
And I <FI>that am<Fi> the LORD thy God from the land of Egypt will yet make thee to dwell in tabernacles, as in the days of the solemn feast.
I have also spoken by the prophets, and I have multiplied visions, and used similitudes, by the ministry of the prophets.<RF>ministry: Heb. hand<Rf>
<FI>Is there<Fi> iniquity <FI>in<Fi> Gilead? surely they are vanity: they sacrifice bullocks in Gilgal; yea, their altars <FI>are<Fi> as heaps in the furrows of the fields.
And Jacob fled into the country of Syria, and Israel served for a wife, and for a wife he kept <FI>sheep<Fi>.
And by a prophet the LORD brought Israel out of Egypt, and by a prophet was he preserved.

Ephraim provoked <FI>him<Fi> to anger most bitterly: therefore shall he leave his blood upon him, and his reproach shall his Lord return unto him.<RF>most…: Heb. with bitternesses<Rf><RF>blood: Heb. bloods<Rf><CM>
